docs.title: Welcome to the Regenerative Ag Coop
docs.text: Since November 2023, several regenerative farmers have come together and begun growing the roots of a new online community. We share our regenerative journeys together. We support each other as we farm.

docs.title: We are regenerative practitioners
docs.text:
We are regenerative farmers and gardeners. We are also students, teachers, landscapers, researchers, artists, media creators, programmers, ... who regenerate or support regeneration through our work. We all share a passion in regenerative agriculture.

We come together to learn with our peers—to grow with fellow practitioners around the world. We believe in harmony. We share together and support each other because we believe we can find more prosperity and wellbeing by working together. Learn more about our community.

Find fellowship on your regenerative journey 💞

Whether you're a seasoned farmer or just starting out, our community is a collaborative place to connect with peers and grow together.

docs.title: Be a part of the change
docs.text:
As we share with our peers, we can…

  • Increase our chances of our mutual success and prosperity.
  • Increase the healing that regenerative agriculture has on our planet, our local communities, and ourselves.
  • Develop fulfilling relationships as we connect on restoring life through the way we choose to farm.

We hope to meet you soon!

🌏 🌍 🌎

We welcome you to come connect with us, exchange ideas, ask & discuss questions, and contribute to community projects. Let's grow together and make a difference!

Come check out our community

docs.title: Community of Practice
docs.text:
We are regenerative practitioners (farmers and gardeners) who support each other. Many of us work mostly alone in our gardens and fields.

We enjoy opportunities to connect with fellow practitioners about our work in regenerative ag. Our online community enables us to grow together with our peers across the world. We exchange experiences, struggles, encouragement, resources, ideas ...

We welcome practitioners from other fields (e.g. teachers, students, artists and creators, landscapers, writers, entrepreneurs, speakers, ...) who regenerate land or support regeneration through their work.

docs.title: Bottom-up
docs.text:
We are peers; we are democratic. Our admins gather input from the community before moving forward on major decisions. As the community grows and is interested, we will host elections for admins and whichever other staff roles we the community deem fit.

Our group respects differing perspectives. We recognize that it's possible we could be wrong—all of us are fallible. We seek growth through listening to others' experiences and perspectives, even when they contradict our own. We honor all regenerative practices including conservation tillage, regenerative grazing, Korean Natural Farming, No-Dig, agroforestry, and much more.

Our group most closely resembles a cooperative, and we intend to form a legally recognized co-op when it makes sense to do so.

docs.title: Contributors
docs.text: We're all members, and we all contribute to our community. Here's some ways we contribute to our community.

docs.title: Moderators
docs.text: Moderators are those who have a special role in keeping our community on-topic and safe for all people. Moderators have permissions to delete messages, kick members, and ban members.

docs.title: Admins
docs.text: Admins are those who are responsible for responding to the voices in our community. Admins work together to implement change on behalf of our community.

docs.title: Regeneration brings us together
docs.text:
Regenerative agriculture is movement towards growing food and raising livestock in a way that enriches (instead of depletes) the ecosystems we farm in. Regenerative ag is a response to multiple impending global crises including depleted soils, destroyed land- and ocean-ecosystems, and climate change.

docs.title: Community Guide
docs.text:
Online communication is different. We lose out on body language, vocal tone, and a lot of what makes connection easy to find meaning in. However, we've found that connection through text, pictures, and videos can be quite meaningful.

docs.title: Chatroom Guide
docs.text: These are the current chatrooms in our community. We would be glad to add more rooms as there's mutual interest!

docs.title: Legend
docs.text:
• Rooms with a 🔒 are private, and are only visible to some roles.

  • Rooms with a 🗑 have "disappearing messages" enabled. Messages in these rooms are deleted after several days have gone by.

docs.title: #welcome
docs.text: • A brief guide for new visitors.

docs.title: #rules
docs.text: • Rules for participating in our community.

docs.title: #announcements
docs.text: • Important news and updates about our community.

docs.title: #🌾-roles
docs.text: • A fun way to share your interests and see others' interests.

docs.title: #👋-introductions
docs.text: • A room for saying hello and sharing a little about your interests and involvements in regenerative ag.

docs.title: #💬-connect (🔒 🗑)
docs.text:
• A private room for Guests and Active Members to connect.

  • 🔒 This room is visible to Guests and Active Members.

  • 🗑 Messages are deleted after 7 days.

docs.title: #💞-community (🔒 🗑)
docs.text:
• A private space for Active Members to connect.

  • 🔒 This room is visible to Active Members.

  • 🗑 Messages are deleted after 7 days.

docs.title: #⭐-favorites
docs.text:
• Share about your favorite books, resources, natives, crops, breeds, and more!

  • 🔒 This room is visible to Active Members.

docs.title: #📔-projects (🔒)
docs.text:
• Share about your projects and follow along others' projects. Feel free to create threads for large projects, short projects, and ideas.

  • 🔒 This room is visible to Active Members.

docs.title: #🤝-community-development (🔒)
docs.text:
• Discuss and collaborate on ideas for improving and developing our community.

  • 🔒 This room is visible to Active Members.

docs.title: #🌈-name-tag-colors (🔒)
docs.text:
• Select your name tag color!

  • 🔒 This room is visible to Active Members.

docs.title: #🌷-quiet-garden (🔒)
docs.text:
• A quiet room for those who are inactive. React with a 👍 in this room to become a Visitor or Active Member again.

  • 🔒 This room is visible to Inactive Members and those with the Inactive role.

docs.title: #🎙-voice-room (🔒 🗑)
docs.text:
• A voice chatroom for talking with Active Members.

  • 🔒 This room is visible to Active Members.

  • 🗑 Textual messages and attachments are deleted after 3 days.

docs.title: #🐷-livestock
docs.text: • Discussions about regeneratively raised livestock including regenerative meat, fish, eggs, and dairy.

docs.title: #🌽-broadacre
docs.text: • Discussions about regeneratively growing bulk food and materials; regenerative cash crops, row-crops, and forage; multi-farm CSAs, farmers markets, food hubs, and distributors.

docs.title: #🍏-orchard
docs.text: • Discussions about regeneratively growing fruit and nut perennials.

docs.title: #🍅-garden
docs.text: • Discussions about regenerative home gardens, urban gardens, market gardens, basement gardens, container gardens, single-farm CSAs, and community gardens.

docs.title: #🦠-amendments-and-inoculants (🔒)
docs.text:
• Discussions about regenerative amendments and inoculants; Compost, JADAM, mulch, foliar sprays, inoculants, manure, minerals, bio-char, compost tea, ...

  • 🔒 This room is visible to Active Members.

docs.title: #🌧-water-cycles
docs.text: • Discussion about anything related to water-cycles & hydrology. Rain, runoff, aquifers, swales, water harvesting, water catchments... Large & small scale impacts of being thoughtful about how water moves on our land and around the world.

docs.title: #🚜-technology
docs.text: • Discussions about Regenerative Agriculture technologies.

docs.title: #🌳-agroforestry
docs.text: • Discussions about growing trees alongside livestock and produce. Food forests, silvopasture, forest gardening, alley cropping ...

docs.title: #🔬-test-results (🔒 🗑)
docs.text:
• Share and discuss test results. SAP test, soil tests, ...

  • 🔒 This room is visible to Active Members.

  • 🗑 Messages are deleted after 365 days.

docs.title: #📚-resources
docs.text:
• Share and discuss regenerative ag books, podcasts, and channels, ...

docs.title: How to contribute
docs.text: Here's some ways you can help our community be more beneficial for everyone 💞

docs.title: Share and connect
docs.text:
• Share what's happening with your farm and projects, so we can learn from your journey.
  • Provide encouragement, validation, feedback, and ideas to fellow community members.
  • More options: How to grow with us

docs.title: Share our group with fellow regenerative practitioners
docs.text:
• You can share a personal discord invitation from the #welcome channel
  • Or you can share our website: regenagcoop.org

docs.title: Share your input, feedback, and ideas
docs.text:
• You can provide input when we occasionally propose important changes. Even just an emoji reaction can be quite validating and helpful 🙂
  • We welcome you to post in #connect, #community, or #community-improvement with your feedback, suggestions, and/or ideas
  • You can message Leo or Josh directly in discord
  • There's even a way to share thoughts anonymously!

docs.title: How to grow with us
docs.text: Here's some ways we recommend participating that will hopefully enable us to grow more together 🙂

docs.title: Share something
docs.text:
Maybe it's a resource you liked, a question you're pondering, something going on in your garden or fields.... We'd love to see a glimpse into your journey.

If you're not sure where to share, we recommend #connect (for guests) and #community (for members).

You're welcome to share with us via text, pictures, videos, and/or links!

docs.title: Leave a "reaction" to someone's message
docs.text: Emojis can add a layer of connection on top of text. You can add a thumbs up 👍, face 😃, heart 💞, or any other reactions on others' posts to respond without posting, and let them know you liked what they shared.

docs.title: Leave a comment or response
docs.text: Most of us share in hopes of connecting. Even just a small comment (e.g. "lovely flowers!") can be a meaningful point of connection with a peer.

docs.title: Take care of yourself
docs.text: You having a comfortable experience is the best way we think we'll get to hang out with you more, so please take care of yourself and only participate when and how you feel most comfortable. Please don't push yourself to the point that hanging becomes uncomfortable or a chore!

docs.title: Check out our values
docs.text: Knowing about our community will help us have more to discuss together. We are a democratic community of practice. We regenerate soil and/or support those who regenerate.

docs.title: Offer your input
docs.text:
We're working on ideas for facilitating more rewarding connection. Your input or idea could very likely help our community be better for you and others. If something is uncomfortable, enjoyable, or you have an idea, please find a comfortable way to share about it with us!

Hearing your perspective will help, even if we've heard a similar perspective before. Democracy works best as more voices are heard and integrated.

docs.title: Get involved with projects
docs.text: (Active members only). Share about a project you're working on, and offer some support in someone else's project!

docs.title: Participate in an event
docs.text:
We're currently working on our first community event. Come check back soon to learn more!

docs.title: Membership roles
docs.text: Membership roles help us foster a more comfortable and enjoyable space to connect in. They give us progressively more possibilities for connection as we participate. For example, when you make your first post, you will be granted access to a private a room which is only visible to people who have recently posted.

docs.title: Visitor
docs.text:
Visitors are those who just joined our community.

Visitors can...

  • Post (and react) in most rooms

Visitors who haven't posted or reacted in 7 days are transitioned to the Inactive role.

docs.title: Guest
docs.text:
Once you create your first post, you will become our Guest.

In addition to what Visitors can do, Guests can...

  • Post in #💬-connect, a room just for Guests and Active Members
  • Share pictures and links
  • Create threads and polls
  • Use custom stickers and emojis

Guests who haven't posted or reacted in 14 days are transitioned to the Inactive role.

docs.title: Active Member
docs.text:
If you post on at least 4 different days* in the last 60 days, you will become an Active Member.

Active Members have full access to our community.

In addition to what Guests can do, Active Members can...

  • Post in #💞-community, #🤝community-development, #📔-projects, #🦠-amendments-and-inoculants, and #🔬-test-results
  • Talk with other active members in #voice-room
  • Choose a name-tag color
  • Share recorded voice messages
  • Create private threads
  • Add custom emojis and stickers to our server

Active Members who haven't posted or reacted in the last 14 days are transitioned to the Inactive Member role.

* Days are measured in the GMT/UTC timezone. If you've posted on 4 different days and haven't gained the role, please try posting on another day.

docs.title: Inactive
docs.text:
Visitors who haven't posted or reacted in 7 days, and Guests who haven't posted or reacted in 14 days, are transitioned to the Inactive role.

Those who are inactive...

  • Can only see #welcome, #rules, #announcements, and a special empty room called #🌷-quiet-garden
  • Can become a Visitor again by reacting with a 👍 to the post in #🌷-quiet-garden
  • Can become a Guest again by reacting with a 👍 to the post in #🌷-quiet-garden IF they have posted at least once in the last six months.

docs.title: Inactive Member
docs.text:
Active Members who haven't posted for 14 days are transitioned to the Inactive Member role.

Inactive Members have the same abilities as those who are Inactive with two exceptions...

  • Inactive Members keep their name-tag color
  • Inactive Members become Active Members again (instead of Visitors) when they react with a 👍 in #🌷-quiet-garden

Inactive Members who haven't posted or reacted for 365 days are transitioned to the Inactive role and lose their name-tag color.
